definitions.meaning:
[c]（思想或理论）体系；方法；制度；体制
an organized set of ideas or theories or a particular way of doing sth

examples.content:
the British educational system
英国的教育制度

a system of government
政体

definitions.meaning:
[c]系统
a group of things, pieces of equipment, etc. that are connected or work together

examples.content:
a transport system
运输系统

a security system
保安系统

definitions.meaning:
[c]身体；（器官）系统
a human or an animal body, or a part of it, 
when it is being thought of as the organs and processes that make it function

examples.content:
the male reproductive system
男性生殖系统

You have to wait until the drugs have passed out of your system.
你必须等到药物排出体外。

definitions.meaning:
[sing]（尤指不公正的统治或管理）制度，体系，集团
the rules or people that control a country or an organization,
especially when they seem to be unfair because you cannot change them

examples.content:
young people rebelling against the system
反抗现行体制的年轻人

You can't beat the system(= you must accept it) .
你斗不过现行的体制。
